document.docAuthor: Han, Hongxiang, Galsworthy, Anthony C. & Xue, Dayong
document.docOrigin: Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society 165 (4)
document.docTitle: Comibaena sheni Han & Galsworthy & Xue 2012, SP. NOV.
document.masterDocTitle: The Comibaenini of China (Geometridae: Geometrinae), with a review of the tribe

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Comibaenini of China (Geometridae: Geometrinae), with a review of the tribe
Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society

subSubSection.paragraph: Description: Antenna in male bipectinate with long rami, outer rami longer than inner rami. Frons and labial palpus brown mixed with white, ventral surface of the latter white. Vertex green. Tegula green, with a sub-basal, pale green band corresponding with the costal band of the forewing, distal part paler. Dorsal side of thorax and abdomen pale green. Hind tibia in male dilated, with hair-pencil, with terminal extension slightly shorter than the first tarsus.

Forewing length: ♂ ♀ 16–17 mm . Wings green. Outer margin of both wings slightly crenulate. Forewing with costal band pale green, tapering towards apex; antemedial line oblique, almost straight, slightly protruding around lower margin of cell; postmedial line almost straight, slightly bent inwards at both ends; tornal patch small, white patches inside, the inner margin of the patch reddish-brown, anal fold dark reddish-brown inside the patch; terminal line small black dots between veins above CuA 2 , and an elongate black line below CuA 2 , dark mixed with a few reddish-brown scales on outer margin of tornal patch. Hindwing with a pink apical patch shaped like half a figure of eight; tornal patch long and narrow, same colour as apical patch; submarginal line yellowish-white, bordering the patches and terminal line; terminal line black, interrupted on vein ends, mixed with pink on apex and tornal angle. Both wings with small dark discal spots. Fringes yellowish-brown on vein ends, white on other parts.

Male genitalia. Uncus totally divided. Socii swollen beyond middle and bent outwards. Valva with apex blunt; costal lobe with ventral- distal half well sclerotized, spinose; ventral margin spinose, with a large tooth at middle; a subapical- central spinose sclerite present. Vinculum quadrate, only slightly concave at middle. Aedeagus quite slender, narrowing further for more than half of posterior end.
Female genitalia. Sterigma rounded. Ductus bursae slender. Corpus bursae very reduced.

Diagnosis: The wing pattern of
Comibaena sheni
is close to that of the species around
Comibaena bajularia
. However, the almost straight postmedial line of
Comibaena sheni
differs from those species, which have a variety of differently shaped postmedial lines; for example, serrate in
Comibaena bajularia
, protruding in
Comibaena amoenaria
, bent inwards in
Comibaena serrulata
, and curved outwards in
Comibaena insulana
. The male genitalia of
Comibaena sheni
are close to those of
Comibaena tancrei
, but the surface of the ventral- distal half of the costal lobe is spinose in
Comibaena sheni
but smooth in
Comibaena tancrei
. In addition, the branches of the vinculum are not prominent in
Comibaena sheni
but distinct in
Comibaena tancrei .

Holotype ♂ , China : Henan : Songxian , Baiyunshan ,
1300 m
,
24.iii.2001
, coll. Shen Xiaocheng , IZCAS slide no. Geom-01053 ( IZCAS )
.
Paratypes : China : 1♀ , same locality as holotype,
1400 m
,
12.vii.2003
, coll. Lu Yanan , IZCAS slide no. Geom-01054 ( IZCAS )
;
1♂ , Mien-shan (Prov. Shansi), Obere Höhe c .
2000 m
,
9.vii.1937
, H. Höne ( ZFMK )
;
1♀ , same locality and collector,
7.vii.1937
( ZFMK )
.
Etymology: This species is named in honour of the collector of the holotype , Shen Xiao-cheng.

Diagnosis: This and the following species,
Comibaena signifera
, are similar and have the following distinctive features of the wing pattern: a slightly falcate forewing apex; an irregularly twisted postmedial line forming a tooth on M 1 ; a whitish forewing marginal area; a black, stick-like discal spot on the hindwing, whereas that of the forewing consists of a brown dot bordered with white scales; costal area of the hindwing scattered with greyish-brown scales; apex with brown patch, extending caudally.

In the wing pattern,
Comibaena argentataria
differs from
Comibaena signifera
in the following features: usually smaller; forewing postmedial line more strongly serrate than in
Comibaena signifera
, protrusion on M 1 longer and pointed, tooth between CuA 2 and vein fold much shorter; discal spot distinctly bordered by white; absence of a brown patch inside the antemedial line and below the cell, which is present in
Comibaena signifera
; hindwing submarginal line less smoothly curved than that of
Comibaena signifera
.

The male genitalia of these two species are quite different: the valva apex of
Comibaena argentataria
is much narrower and hooked (almost pointed on left, blunt on right), but blunt in
Comibaena signifera
; and the costal lobe of
Comibaena argentataria
is very broad, lacking the central ventral tooth, whereas it is much narrower distally and has a small central ventral tooth in
Comibaena signifera
.

The sterigmata differ in the female genitalia, labiate in
Comibaena argentataria
, but oval in
Comibaena signifera
.

Type material examined:
Korea : 1♂ 1♀ , syntypes , Gensan
Corea , Ito Coll. ,
vii.1887
, Leech Coll. 1900-64 ( BMNH )
;
China : 1♂ , syntype , Chang Yang, A.E . Pratt Coll.,
v.1888
, Leech Coll. 1900-64 ( BMNH )
.

Additional material examined:
China : 32♂ 5♀ , southern
China , March to September ( IZCAS , BMNH , ZFMK )
;
Japan : 5♂ , July to August ( BMNH , ZFMK )
.
Distribution: China ( Zhejiang , Hubei , Jiangxi , Hunan , Fujian , Taiwan , Guangdong, Guangxi, Sichuan), Japan , Korean Peninsula.
